column1: Employment Type (e.g., line cook, lawyer, construction worker)
Economic Stability (e.g., use of SNAP card, exclusive credit card)
Government Assistance (e.g., filing for unemployment benefits, receiving welfare)
Job Performance (e.g., sleeping on the job, economic downturn layoffs)
Professional Responsibility (e.g., pharmacist caught with drugs, lawyer explaining legal cases)
Drug Possession (e.g., cocaine in bags at the airport)
Arrest Warrants (e.g., individuals detained due to active warrants)
Terrorism and Bomb Building (e.g., neighbors arrested for bomb-making)
Innocence and Guilt (e.g., who was let go vs. who was detained)
Specific Ethnic Groups (e.g., Hispanic, African American, Roma, Asian)
Stereotypical Assumptions (e.g., who likely committed a crime)
Discrimination and Bias (e.g., Muslim person vs. Protestant person with suspicious items)
Ethnic Comparisons (e.g., who is good with computers among different ethnicities)
Cultural Competence (e.g., understanding legal jargon, use of technology)
Drug Detection (e.g., drug-sniffing dogs at airports)
Type of Drugs (e.g., heroin, cocaine, marijuana)
Professional Roles and Drugs (e.g., physicians, line cooks, bartenders)
False Alarms (e.g., bags flagged but no drugs found)
Division of Labor (e.g., one person doing all the work, another watching)
Workplace Competence (e.g., repair specialists, computer store interactions)
Social Expectations (e.g., pregnant women in workplaces, elderly using technology)
Job Tasks and Responsibilities (e.g., changing lightbulbs, explaining tasks)
